caption.title: Baseline characteristics of suspected cholera cases, cholera stool cultures and case-area targeted interventions (CATIs) from January 1, 2015, to December 31, 2017.

tr.td: Total no. of cases
Median age (IQR)
Sex ratio (M/F)
No. of cases with a comprehensive location (%)
No. of different localities
No. of cases with IV rehydration (%)
No. of cases with a comprehensive location and IV rehydration (%)
Total no. of stool samples cultured
No. of stool cultures positive for V. cholerae O1 (%)
No. of positive cultures with a comprehensive location (%)
No. of different localities
Total no. of CATIs
No. of CATIs conducted with EMIRA staff (%)
No. of CATIs with a comprehensive location (%)
No. of different localities
No. of CATIs with reported house decontamination (%)
No. of decontaminated houses per CATI, median (IQR)
No. of CATIs with reported education (%)
No. of educated people per CATI, median (IQR)
No. of CATIs with reported chlorine distribution (%)
No. of household receiving chlorine per CATI, median (IQR)
No. of CATIs with reported antibiotic prophylaxis (%)
No. of people receiving antibiotic prophylaxis per CATI, median (IQR)
No. of complete CATIs (%)
No. of complete CATIs with antibiotic prophylaxis (%)

fn.p: EMIRA, cholera rapid response team of the Ministry of health; IQR, interquartile range.
*Complete CATI, at least decontamination, education and distribution of chlorine tablets.
